intro: Mammea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan mammea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
